articles.title: –û—Å–Ω–æ–≤–∏ –∞–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫–æ—ó –≥—Ä–∞–º–∞—Ç–∏–∫–∏ –¥–ª—è –ø–æ—á–∞—Ç–∫—ñ–≤—Ü—ñ–≤: –ü–æ—Å—ñ–±–Ω–∏–∫ –¥–ª—è —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Ü—ñ–≤
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

–ê–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫–∞ –≥—Ä–∞–º–∞—Ç–∏–∫–∞ –Ω–∞–±–∞–≥–∞—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—ñ—à–∞ –∑–∞ —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫—É! –ù–µ–º–∞—î –≤—ñ–¥–º—ñ–Ω–∫—ñ–≤, —Ä–æ–¥—ñ–≤ –¥–ª—è —ñ–º–µ–Ω–Ω–∏–∫—ñ–≤ —Ç–∞ —Å–∫–ª–∞–¥–Ω–æ—ó —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∏ –¥—ñ—î–≤—ñ–¥–º—ñ–Ω—é–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è. –£ —Ü—å–æ–º—É –ø–æ—Å—ñ–±–Ω–∏–∫—É –º–∏ —Ä–æ–∑–≥–ª—è–Ω–µ–º–æ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–∏, —è–∫—ñ –¥–æ–ø–æ–º–æ–∂—É—Ç—å –≤–∞–º —à–≤–∏–¥–∫–æ –ø–æ—á–∞—Ç–∏ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏ –∞–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫–æ—é.

## –ü–æ—Ä—è–¥–æ–∫ —Å–ª—ñ–≤ —É —Ä–µ—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ñ

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Subject + Verb + Object (SVO)"
  translation="–ü—ñ–¥–º–µ—Ç + –î—ñ—î—Å–ª–æ–≤–æ + –î–æ–¥–∞—Ç–æ–∫"
  pronunciation=""
  context="–û—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω–∏–π –ø–æ—Ä—è–¥–æ–∫ —Å–ª—ñ–≤ –≤ –∞–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫—ñ–π –º–æ–≤—ñ ‚Äî –∑–∞–≤–∂–¥–∏ —Ñ—ñ–∫—Å–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π!"
/>

–ù–∞ –≤—ñ–¥–º—ñ–Ω—É –≤—ñ–¥ —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–æ—ó, –¥–µ –ø–æ—Ä—è–¥–æ–∫ —Å–ª—ñ–≤ –≥–Ω—É—á–∫–∏–π, –≤ –∞–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫—ñ–π –≤—ñ–Ω —Ñ—ñ–∫—Å–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π:

<VocabCard
  word="I love you"
  translation="–Ø –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é —Ç–µ–±–µ"
  pronunciation="–∞–π –ª–∞–≤ —é"
  example="–ü—ñ–¥–º–µ—Ç (I) + –î—ñ—î—Å–ª–æ–≤–æ (love) + –î–æ–¥–∞—Ç–æ–∫ (you)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="She speaks English"
  translation="–í–æ–Ω–∞ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç—å –∞–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫–æ—é"
  pronunciation="—à—ñ —Å–ø—ñ–∫—Å —ñ–Ω–≥–ª—ñ—à"
  example="–ü—ñ–¥–º–µ—Ç (She) + –î—ñ—î—Å–ª–æ–≤–æ (speaks) + –î–æ–¥–∞—Ç–æ–∫ (English)"
/>

<CultureTip title="–ß–æ–º—É —Ü–µ –≤–∞–∂–ª–∏–≤–æ" flag="üá¨üáß">
–í —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫—ñ–π –º–æ–∂–Ω–∞ —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç–∏ "–ö–æ—Ö–∞—é —Ç–µ–±–µ —è" –¥–ª—è –µ–º—Ñ–∞–∑–∏. –í –∞–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫—ñ–π —Ç–∞–∫ –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–∞—Ü—é—î ‚Äî –∑–º—ñ–Ω–∏–≤—à–∏ –ø–æ—Ä—è–¥–æ–∫ —Å–ª—ñ–≤, –≤–∏ –∑–º—ñ–Ω–∏—Ç–µ –∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è –∞–±–æ —Ä–µ—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–µ –Ω–µ–≥—Ä–∞–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–Ω–∏–º.
</CultureTip>

## –û—Å–æ–±–æ–≤—ñ –∑–∞–π–º–µ–Ω–Ω–∏–∫–∏

<ConjugationTable
  verb="Personal Pronouns"
  meaning="–û—Å–æ–±–æ–≤—ñ –∑–∞–π–º–µ–Ω–Ω–∏–∫–∏"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "I", polish: "—è", english: "–∞–π" },
    { person: "You", polish: "—Ç–∏/–≤–∏", english: "—é" },
    { person: "He", polish: "–≤—ñ–Ω", english: "—Ö—ñ" },
    { person: "She", polish: "–≤–æ–Ω–∞", english: "—à—ñ" },
    { person: "It", polish: "–≤–æ–Ω–æ", english: "—ñ—Ç" },
    { person: "We", polish: "–º–∏", english: "–≤—ñ" },
    { person: "They", polish: "–≤–æ–Ω–∏", english: "–∑–µ–π" }
  ]}
/>

### –í–∞–∂–ª–∏–≤–∞ —Ä—ñ–∑–Ω–∏—Ü—è

<VocabCard
  word="You"
  translation="–¢–∏ / –í–∏ (–æ–¥–Ω–∏–Ω–∞ —ñ –º–Ω–æ–∂–∏–Ω–∞)"
  pronunciation="—é"
  example="–í –∞–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫—ñ–π 'you' –¥–ª—è –æ–¥–Ω—ñ—î—ó –ª—é–¥–∏–Ω–∏ —ñ –¥–ª—è –±–∞–≥–∞—Ç—å–æ—Ö ‚Äî –æ–¥–Ω–∞–∫–æ–≤–µ!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="It"
  translation="–í–æ–Ω–æ (–¥–ª—è —Ä–µ—á–µ–π, —Ç–≤–∞—Ä–∏–Ω, –ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç—å)"
  pronunciation="—ñ—Ç"
  example="The book is interesting. It is interesting. (–ö–Ω–∏–≥–∞ —Ü—ñ–∫–∞–≤–∞. –í–æ–Ω–∞ —Ü—ñ–∫–∞–≤–∞.)"
/>

## –î—ñ—î—Å–ª–æ–≤–æ "to be" ‚Äî –ë—É—Ç–∏

–¶–µ –Ω–∞–π–≤–∞–∂–ª–∏–≤—ñ—à–µ –¥—ñ—î—Å–ª–æ–≤–æ –≤ –∞–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫—ñ–π!

<ConjugationTable
  verb="To Be (Present)"
  meaning="–±—É—Ç–∏ (—Ç–µ–ø–µ—Ä—ñ—à–Ω—ñ–π —á–∞—Å)"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "I", polish: "am", english: "—è —î ‚Üí I am happy" },
    { person: "You", polish: "are", english: "—Ç–∏ —î ‚Üí You are kind" },
    { person: "He/She/It", polish: "is", english: "–≤—ñ–Ω/–≤–æ–Ω–∞ —î ‚Üí He is tall" },
    { person: "We", polish: "are", english: "–º–∏ —î ‚Üí We are students" },
    { person: "They", polish: "are", english: "–≤–æ–Ω–∏ —î ‚Üí They are friends" }
  ]}
/>

<VocabCard
  word="I am Ukrainian"
  translation="–Ø —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–µ—Ü—å/—É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–∫–∞"
  pronunciation="–∞–π –µ–º —é–∫—Ä–µ–π–Ω—ñ–µ–Ω"
  example="–í –∞–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫—ñ–π –æ–±–æ–≤'—è–∑–∫–æ–≤–æ –ø–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–µ–Ω 'am' ‚Äî –Ω–µ –º–æ–∂–Ω–∞ —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ 'I Ukrainian'"
/>

### –°–∫–æ—Ä–æ—á–µ–Ω—ñ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∏

<VocabCard
  word="I'm, You're, He's, She's, It's, We're, They're"
  translation="–°–∫–æ—Ä–æ—á–µ–Ω—ñ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∏ to be"
  pronunciation=""
  example="I'm happy = I am happy; He's nice = He is nice"
/>

<CultureTip title="–°–∫–æ—Ä–æ—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è ‚Äî —Ü–µ –Ω–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ!" flag="üá∫üá∏">
–í —Ä–æ–∑–º–æ–≤–Ω—ñ–π –∞–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫—ñ–π –∑–∞–≤–∂–¥–∏ –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É—é—Ç—å —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è: "I'm", "you're", "he's". –ü–æ–≤–Ω—ñ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∏ –∑–≤—É—á–∞—Ç—å –∑–∞–Ω–∞–¥—Ç–æ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ –¥–ª—è —â–æ–¥–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Å–ø—ñ–ª–∫—É–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—è.
</CultureTip>

## –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—ñ—à–Ω—ñ–π –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–∏–π —á–∞—Å (Present Simple)

–í–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É—î—Ç—å—Å—è –¥–ª—è –∑–≤–∏—á–æ–∫, —Ñ–∞–∫—Ç—ñ–≤ —Ç–∞ —Ä–µ–≥—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω–∏—Ö –¥—ñ–π.

<ConjugationTable
  verb="To Love (Present Simple)"
  meaning="–∫–æ—Ö–∞—Ç–∏"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "I", polish: "love", english: "—è –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é" },
    { person: "You", polish: "love", english: "—Ç–∏ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—î—à" },
    { person: "He/She/It", polish: "loves", english: "–≤—ñ–Ω/–≤–æ–Ω–∞ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—î" },
    { person: "We", polish: "love", english: "–º–∏ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—î–º–æ" },
    { person: "They", polish: "love", english: "–≤–æ–Ω–∏ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—é—Ç—å" }
  ]}
/>

### –ü—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–æ: He/She/It + -s

<VocabCard
  word="She loves coffee"
  translation="–í–æ–Ω–∞ –ª—é–±–∏—Ç—å –∫–∞–≤—É"
  pronunciation="—à—ñ –ª–∞–≤—Å –∫–æ—Ñ—ñ"
  example="–î–ª—è he/she/it –∑–∞–≤–∂–¥–∏ –¥–æ–¥–∞—î–º–æ -s –¥–æ –¥—ñ—î—Å–ª–æ–≤–∞!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="He works every day"
  translation="–í—ñ–Ω –ø—Ä–∞—Ü—é—î —â–æ–¥–Ω—è"
  pronunciation="—Ö—ñ –≤–æ—Ä–∫—Å –µ–≤—Ä—ñ –¥–µ–π"
  example="work ‚Üí works –¥–ª—è —Ç—Ä–µ—Ç—å–æ—ó –æ—Å–æ–±–∏"
/>

### –ó–∞–ø–µ—Ä–µ—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è –∑ "don't/doesn't"

<VocabCard
  word="I don't understand"
  translation="–Ø –Ω–µ —Ä–æ–∑—É–º—ñ—é"
  pronunciation="–∞–π –¥–æ–Ω—Ç –∞–Ω–¥–µ—Ä—Å—Ç–µ–Ω–¥"
  example="–î–ª—è I/you/we/they: do not = don't"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="She doesn't speak Ukrainian"
  translation="–í–æ–Ω–∞ –Ω–µ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç—å —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–æ—é"
  pronunciation="—à—ñ –¥–∞–∑–Ω—Ç —Å–ø—ñ–∫ —é–∫—Ä–µ–π–Ω—ñ–µ–Ω"
  example="–î–ª—è he/she/it: does not = doesn't (–¥—ñ—î—Å–ª–æ–≤–æ –±–µ–∑ -s!)"
/>

### –ü–∏—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω—è –∑ "do/does"

<VocabCard
  word="Do you love me?"
  translation="–¢–∏ –º–µ–Ω–µ –∫–æ—Ö–∞—î—à?"
  pronunciation="–¥—É —é –ª–∞–≤ –º—ñ"
  example="Do + –ø—ñ–¥–º–µ—Ç + –¥—ñ—î—Å–ª–æ–≤–æ?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Does she work here?"
  translation="–í–æ–Ω–∞ —Ç—É—Ç –ø—Ä–∞—Ü—é—î?"
  pronunciation="–¥–∞–∑ —à—ñ –≤–æ—Ä–∫ —Ö—ñ—Ä"
  example="Does + –ø—ñ–¥–º–µ—Ç + –¥—ñ—î—Å–ª–æ–≤–æ (–±–µ–∑ -s!)?"
/>

## –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—ñ—à–Ω—ñ–π —Ç—Ä–∏–≤–∞–ª–∏–π —á–∞—Å (Present Continuous)

–í–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É—î—Ç—å—Å—è –¥–ª—è –¥—ñ–π, —â–æ –≤—ñ–¥–±—É–≤–∞—é—Ç—å—Å—è –∑–∞—Ä–∞–∑.

<VocabCard
  word="I am working"
  translation="–Ø –ø—Ä–∞—Ü—é—é (–∑–∞—Ä–∞–∑)"
  pronunciation="–∞–π –µ–º –≤–æ—Ä–∫—ñ–Ω–≥"
  example="to be + –¥—ñ—î—Å–ª–æ–≤–æ + -ing"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="She is cooking dinner"
  translation="–í–æ–Ω–∞ –≥–æ—Ç—É—î –≤–µ—á–µ—Ä—é (–∑–∞—Ä–∞–∑)"
  pronunciation="—à—ñ —ñ–∑ –∫—É–∫—ñ–Ω–≥ –¥—ñ–Ω–µ—Ä"
  example="is + cooking"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="We are learning English"
  translation="–ú–∏ –≤–∏–≤—á–∞—î–º–æ –∞–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫—É (–∑–∞—Ä–∞–∑/–≤ —Ü–µ–π –ø–µ—Ä—ñ–æ–¥)"
  pronunciation="–≤—ñ –∞—Ä –ª–µ—Ä–Ω—ñ–Ω–≥ —ñ–Ω–≥–ª—ñ—à"
  example="are + learning"
/>

<CultureTip title="Present Simple vs Present Continuous" flag="üá¨üáß">
Present Simple: "I work in a bank" (–Ø –ø—Ä–∞—Ü—é—é –≤ –±–∞–Ω–∫—É ‚Äî —Ü–µ –º–æ—è –ø–æ—Å—Ç—ñ–π–Ω–∞ —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç–∞)
Present Continuous: "I'm working now" (–Ø –ø—Ä–∞—Ü—é—é –∑–∞—Ä–∞–∑ ‚Äî —Å–∞–º–µ –≤ —Ü–µ–π –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç)
</CultureTip>

## –ú–∏–Ω—É–ª–∏–π —á–∞—Å (Past Simple)

### –ü—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω—ñ –¥—ñ—î—Å–ª–æ–≤–∞: + -ed

<VocabCard
  word="I worked yesterday"
  translation="–Ø –ø—Ä–∞—Ü—é–≤–∞–≤ –≤—á–æ—Ä–∞"
  pronunciation="–∞–π –≤–æ—Ä–∫—Ç —î—Å—Ç–µ—Ä–¥–µ–π"
  example="work ‚Üí worked"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="She loved the movie"
  translation="–á–π —Å–ø–æ–¥–æ–±–∞–≤—Å—è —Ñ—ñ–ª—å–º"
  pronunciation="—à—ñ –ª–∞–≤–¥ –∑–µ –º—É–≤—ñ"
  example="love ‚Üí loved"
/>

### –ù–µ–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω—ñ –¥—ñ—î—Å–ª–æ–≤–∞

<VocabCard
  word="I went to the store"
  translation="–Ø —Ö–æ–¥–∏–≤ –¥–æ –º–∞–≥–∞–∑–∏–Ω—É"
  pronunciation="–∞–π –≤–µ–Ω—Ç —Ç—É –∑–µ —Å—Ç–æ—Ä"
  example="go ‚Üí went (–Ω–µ–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–µ –¥—ñ—î—Å–ª–æ–≤–æ)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="She saw him yesterday"
  translation="–í–æ–Ω–∞ –±–∞—á–∏–ª–∞ –π–æ–≥–æ –≤—á–æ—Ä–∞"
  pronunciation="—à—ñ —Å–æ —Ö—ñ–º —î—Å—Ç–µ—Ä–¥–µ–π"
  example="see ‚Üí saw (–Ω–µ–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–µ –¥—ñ—î—Å–ª–æ–≤–æ)"
/>

### –ó–∞–ø–µ—Ä–µ—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è —Ç–∞ –ø–∏—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω—è

<VocabCard
  word="I didn't go"
  translation="–Ø –Ω–µ —Ö–æ–¥–∏–≤"
  pronunciation="–∞–π –¥—ñ–¥–µ–Ω—Ç –≥–æ—É"
  example="did not = didn't + —ñ–Ω—Ñ—ñ–Ω—ñ—Ç–∏–≤ (–±–µ–∑ -ed!)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Did you see that?"
  translation="–¢–∏ –±–∞—á–∏–≤ —Ü–µ?"
  pronunciation="–¥—ñ–¥ —é —Å—ñ –∑–µ—Ç"
  example="Did + –ø—ñ–¥–º–µ—Ç + —ñ–Ω—Ñ—ñ–Ω—ñ—Ç–∏–≤?"
/>

## –ê—Ä—Ç–∏–∫–ª—ñ: A, An, The

–¶–µ —Ç–µ, —á–æ–≥–æ –Ω–µ–º–∞—î –≤ —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫—ñ–π, –∞–ª–µ –¥—É–∂–µ –≤–∞–∂–ª–∏–≤–æ –≤ –∞–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫—ñ–π!

<VocabCard
  word="A / An"
  translation="–ù–µ–≤–∏–∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–∏–π –∞—Ä—Ç–∏–∫–ª—å (—è–∫–∏–π—Å—å, –æ–¥–∏–Ω)"
  pronunciation="–µ / –µ–Ω"
  example="a book (—è–∫–∞—Å—å –∫–Ω–∏–≥–∞), an apple (—è–∫–µ—Å—å —è–±–ª—É–∫–æ ‚Äî –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥ –≥–æ–ª–æ—Å–Ω–æ—é)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="The"
  translation="–í–∏–∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–∏–π –∞—Ä—Ç–∏–∫–ª—å (—Ç–æ–π —Å–∞–º–∏–π, –∫–æ–Ω–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω–∏–π)"
  pronunciation="–∑–µ / –∑—ñ"
  example="the book (—Ç–∞ –∫–Ω–∏–≥–∞, –ø—Ä–æ —è–∫—É –º–∏ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–º–æ)"
/>

### –ü—Ä–∏–∫–ª–∞–¥–∏

<VocabCard
  word="I saw a cat. The cat was black."
  translation="–Ø –±–∞—á–∏–≤ –∫–æ—Ç–∞. –ö—ñ—Ç –±—É–≤ —á–æ—Ä–Ω–∏–π."
  pronunciation="–∞–π —Å–æ –µ –∫–µ—Ç. –∑–µ –∫–µ—Ç –≤–æ–∑ –±–ª–µ–∫"
  example="–°–ø–æ—á–∞—Ç–∫—É 'a' (–Ω–æ–≤–∏–π –∫—ñ—Ç), –ø–æ—Ç—ñ–º 'the' (—Ç–æ–π —Å–∞–º–∏–π –∫—ñ—Ç)"
/>

<CultureTip title="–ö–æ–ª–∏ –Ω–µ –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –∞—Ä—Ç–∏–∫–ª—å" flag="üá¨üáß">
–ë–µ–∑ –∞—Ä—Ç–∏–∫–ª—è: —ñ–º–µ–Ω–∞ (Mary), –∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–∏ (Ukraine, –∞–ª–µ The USA), –º–æ–≤–∏ (English), –∞–±—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–Ω—ñ –ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç—Ç—è (love, happiness).
</CultureTip>


## –ü–æ—Ä—ñ–≤–Ω—è–Ω–Ω—è –∑ —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–æ—é

| –ê–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫–∞ | –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–∞ | –ü—Ä–∏–º—ñ—Ç–∫–∞ |
|------------|------------|----------|
| –§—ñ–∫—Å–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π –ø–æ—Ä—è–¥–æ–∫ —Å–ª—ñ–≤ | –ì–Ω—É—á–∫–∏–π –ø–æ—Ä—è–¥–æ–∫ | –ê–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫–∞ —Å—É–≤–æ—Ä—ñ—à–∞ |
| –ù–µ–º–∞—î —Ä–æ–¥—ñ–≤ | –Ñ —Ä–æ–¥–∏ | –ü—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—ñ—à–µ! |
| –ù–µ–º–∞—î –≤—ñ–¥–º—ñ–Ω–∫—ñ–≤ | –Ñ –≤—ñ–¥–º—ñ–Ω–∫–∏ | –ù–∞–±–∞–≥–∞—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—ñ—à–µ! |
| –Ñ –∞—Ä—Ç–∏–∫–ª—ñ | –ù–µ–º–∞—î –∞—Ä—Ç–∏–∫–ª—ñ–≤ | –ü–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–Ω–æ –≤–∏–≤—á–∏—Ç–∏ |
| –ü—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—ñ –¥—ñ—î—Å–ª–æ–≤–∞ | –°–∫–ª–∞–¥–Ω—ñ –¥—ñ—î—Å–ª–æ–≤–∞ | –ê–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—ñ—à–∞ |

## –ù–∞–π–ø–æ—à–∏—Ä–µ–Ω—ñ—à—ñ –ø–æ–º–∏–ª–∫–∏ —É–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Ü—ñ–≤

1. **–ü—Ä–æ–ø—É—Å–∫ "to be"**: ~~"I happy"~~ ‚Üí "I am happy"
2. **–ü—Ä–æ–ø—É—Å–∫ –∞—Ä—Ç–∏–∫–ª—ñ–≤**: ~~"I have book"~~ ‚Üí "I have a book"
3. **–ü–æ–¥–≤—ñ–π–Ω–µ –∑–∞–ø–µ—Ä–µ—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è**: ~~"I don't know nothing"~~ ‚Üí "I don't know anything"
4. **–ó–∞–±—É—Ç—Ç—è -s**: ~~"She love"~~ ‚Üí "She loves"

<CTA
  text="–ì–æ—Ç–æ–≤—ñ –≤–∏–≤—á–∞—Ç–∏ –∞–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫—É –≥—Ä–∞–º–∞—Ç–∏–∫—É –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—Ü—ñ?"
  buttonText="–ü–æ—á–∞—Ç–∏ –≤—á–∏—Ç–∏—Å—è —Ä–∞–∑–æ–º"
/>

articles.title: T√∂r√∂k kifejez√©sek az ap√≥s √©s any√≥s megismer√©s√©hez
articles.content:
# T√∂r√∂k kifejez√©sek az ap√≥s √©s any√≥s megismer√©s√©hez

A t√∂r√∂k kult√∫r√°ban a csal√°d az √©let k√∂z√©ppontja. Az ap√≥s √©s any√≥s megismer√©se k√ºl√∂n√∂sen fontos esem√©ny, amelyre √©rdemes alaposan felk√©sz√ºlni.

## Alapvet≈ë √ºdv√∂zl√©sek

### Merhaba!
**Kiejt√©s:** mer-HA-ba
**Jelent√©s:** Hell√≥! / √údv√∂zl√∂m!

√Åltal√°nos √ºdv√∂zl√©s, b√°rmilyen napszakban haszn√°lhat√≥.

### Tanƒ±≈ütƒ±ƒüƒ±mƒ±za memnun oldum
**Kiejt√©s:** ta-nis-ti-i-mi-za mem-NUN ol-DUM
**Jelent√©s:** √ñr√ºl√∂k, hogy megismerhetem.

Form√°lis kifejez√©s az els≈ë tal√°lkoz√°sra.

### Benim adƒ±m...
**Kiejt√©s:** be-NIM a-dim...
**Jelent√©s:** A nevem...

## Tiszteletteljes megsz√≥l√≠t√°sok

### Anne / Baba
**Kiejt√©s:** AN-ne / BA-ba
**Jelent√©s:** Anya / Apa

A t√∂r√∂k kult√∫r√°ban a h√°zass√°g ut√°n az any√≥st √©s ap√≥st gyakran Anne √©s Baba n√©ven sz√≥l√≠tj√°k - ez a tisztelet jele.

### Efendim
**Kiejt√©s:** e-FEN-dim
**Jelent√©s:** Uram / H√∂lgyem (tiszteletteljes)

Rendk√≠v√ºl udvarias megsz√≥l√≠t√°s, id≈ësebb emberekkel szemben.

## B√≥kok √©s k√∂sz√∂net

### √áok g√ºzel bir eviniz var
**Kiejt√©s:** csok g√º-ZEL bir e-vi-NIZ var
**Jelent√©s:** Nagyon sz√©p otthonuk van.

### Davet i√ßin te≈üekk√ºr ederim
**Kiejt√©s:** da-VET i-csin te-sek-K√úR e-de-RIM
**Jelent√©s:** K√∂sz√∂n√∂m a megh√≠v√°st.

### √áok lezzetli!
**Kiejt√©s:** csok lez-ZET-li
**Jelent√©s:** Nagyon finom!

A t√∂r√∂k any√≥sok sokat f≈ëznek, √©s a dics√©ret elengedhetetlen.

### Elinize saƒülƒ±k
**Kiejt√©s:** e-li-NI-ze sza-LIK
**Jelent√©s:** Eg√©szs√©g a kez√©hez (k√∂sz√∂net a f≈ëz√©s√©rt)

Ez a hagyom√°nyos kifejez√©s a f≈ëz√©s megk√∂sz√∂n√©s√©re - nagyon j√≥ benyom√°st tesz!

## A kapcsolatr√≥l

### Oƒülunuzu / Kƒ±zƒ±nƒ±zƒ± √ßok seviyorum
**Kiejt√©s:** o-lu-nu-ZU / ki-zi-ni-ZI csok sze-vi-jo-RUM
**Jelent√©s:** Nagyon szeretem a fiukat / l√°nyukat.

### Birlikte √ßok mutluyuz
**Kiejt√©s:** bir-LIK-te csok mut-lu-JUZ
**Jelent√©s:** Nagyon boldogok vagyunk egy√ºtt.

## √ârdekl≈ëd√©s a csal√°dr√≥l

### Aileniz hakkƒ±nda daha √ßok ≈üey √∂ƒürenmek istiyorum
**Kiejt√©s:** a-i-le-NIZ hak-kin-DA da-HA csok sej √∂r-en-MEK isz-ti-jo-RUM
**Jelent√©s:** T√∂bbet szeretn√©k megtudni a csal√°djukr√≥l.

### Bu yemeƒüi yapmayƒ± √∂ƒüretir misiniz?
**Kiejt√©s:** bu je-me-I jap-ma-JI √∂r-e-TIR mi-szi-NIZ
**Jelent√©s:** Megtan√≠tan√°k, hogyan kell ezt az √©telt elk√©sz√≠teni?

## B√∫cs√∫z√°s

### Ho≈ü√ßa kalƒ±n!
**Kiejt√©s:** HOS-csa ka-LIN
**Jelent√©s:** Viszontl√°t√°sra! (ha te m√©sz el)

### √áok g√ºzel vakit ge√ßirdik
**Kiejt√©s:** csok g√º-ZEL va-KIT ge-csir-DIK
**Jelent√©s:** Nagyon j√≥l √©rezt√ºk magunkat.

## Kultur√°lis tan√°csok

**Aj√°nd√©k:** Vigy√©l min≈ës√©gi √©dess√©get (lokum, baklava), vir√°got, vagy ha tudod, mi a kedvenc m√°rk√°juk, k√°v√©t.

**Cip≈ë:** A bej√°ratn√°l vedd le a cip≈ëd - ez alapvet≈ë illemszab√°ly.

**√âtkez√©s:** K√©sz√ºlj fel b≈ës√©ges √©tkez√©sre! Visszautas√≠tani az √©telt s√©rt√©s. Ha tele vagy, mondj k√∂sz√∂netet √©s magyar√°zd el udvariasan.

**Tea √©s k√°v√©:** A t√∂r√∂k k√°v√© √©s tea a vend√©gl√°t√°s r√©sze. Mindig fogadd el!

**Fizikai kontaktus:** Az id≈ësebb n≈ëkkel szemben l√©gy visszafogott, a f√©rfiakkal k√©zfog√°s megfelel≈ë. A vall√°sosabb csal√°dokban a n≈ëk √©s f√©rfiak k√∂z√∂tti fizikai kontaktus korl√°tozott lehet.

A magyar-t√∂r√∂k t√∂rt√©nelmi kapcsolatok miatt sok kultur√°lis hasonl√≥s√°g van - haszn√°ld ezt el≈ëny√∂dre a besz√©lget√©sben!

articles.title: Czech Flirting Phrases: Romantic Expressions for Your Czech Partner
articles.content:
Czech may seem challenging at first, but the language offers beautiful, poetic ways to express love. Czech speakers appreciate sincere romantic effort, and your attempts will touch their hearts deeply.

## The Czech Heart of Romance

Czech culture values genuineness and depth. Flirting (*flirtov√°n√≠*) combines warmth with a certain poetic sensibility that makes romantic phrases particularly meaningful.

## Essential Flirting Phrases

### Heartfelt Compliments

**Jsi tak kr√°sn√° / Jsi tak kr√°sn√Ω**
*(Ysi tak kras-na / Ysi tak kras-nee)*
*You are so beautiful / You are so handsome*

Use *kr√°sn√°* for women, *kr√°sn√Ω* for men. Direct and sincere.

**M√°≈° n√°dhern√© oƒçi**
*(Mash nad-hair-ne o-chi)*
*You have gorgeous eyes*

*N√°dhern√Ω* (gorgeous) elevates the compliment beyond simple beauty.

**Tv≈Øj √∫smƒõv mi rozz√°≈ô√≠ den**
*(Tvoo-y oos-myev mi roz-za-ree den)*
*Your smile brightens my day*

A warm expression of how their joy affects your life.

### Expressing Attraction

**Nem≈Ø≈æu p≈ôestat myslet na tebe**
*(Ne-moo-zhu przhe-stat mis-let na te-be)*
*I can't stop thinking about you*

A sincere admission of romantic preoccupation.

**≈†√≠l√≠m z tebe**
*(Shee-leem z te-be)*
*You drive me crazy*

Playfully passionate‚Äîthey make you lose control.

**S tebou se c√≠t√≠m doma**
*(S te-bow se tsee-teem do-ma)*
*With you I feel at home*

Feeling "home" with someone is deeply romantic in Czech culture.

### Romantic Declarations

**Jsi moje v≈°echno**
*(Ysi mo-ye vshekh-no)*
*You are my everything*

Simple but complete‚Äîthey encompass your world.

**M√© srdce pat≈ô√≠ tobƒõ**
*(Me srd-tse pa-trzhi to-bye)*
*My heart belongs to you*

A declaration of complete devotion.

**Jsi l√°ska m√©ho ≈æivota**
*(Ysi las-ka me-ho zhi-vo-ta)*
*You are the love of my life*

Reserve for deep commitment‚Äîit carries tremendous weight.

### Sweet Expressions

**Dƒõl√°≈° mƒõ ≈°≈•astn√Ωm / ≈°≈•astnou**
*(Dye-lash mye shtyas-tneem / shtyas-tno)*
*You make me happy*

Use *≈°≈•astn√Ωm* if male, *≈°≈•astnou* if female.

**Ka≈æd√Ω den tƒõ miluju v√≠c**
*(Kazh-dee den tye mi-lu-yu veets)*
*Every day I love you more*

Love that continues to grow.

**M√°m ≈°tƒõst√≠, ≈æe tƒõ m√°m**
*(Mam shtyes-tee zhe tye mam)*
*I'm lucky to have you*

Gratitude combined with love.

## Czech Terms of Endearment

- **L√°sko** (las-ko) ‚Äî Love
- **Mil√°ƒçku** (mi-lach-ku) ‚Äî Darling
- **Zlat√≠ƒçko** (zla-teech-ko) ‚Äî Golden one
- **Drahou≈°ku** (dra-how-shku) ‚Äî Dear one

## Czech Romantic Culture

**Sincerity valued**: Genuine feeling matters more than elaborate words.

**Poetry tradition**: Czech literature has beautiful romantic poetry.

**Modest expression**: Czechs may understate feelings but love deeply.

**Humor appreciated**: Light, witty flirtation is welcome.

## Pronunciation Tips

- **≈ò** is unique to Czech‚Äîrolled r with slight friction
- **ƒå** sounds like "ch" in "church"
- **≈†** sounds like "sh"
- **≈Ω** sounds like "s" in "measure"
- **ƒö** after consonants softens them

## Building Romance

Start with simpler phrases and common endearments. Czech pronunciation is challenging, but your effort will deeply impress your partner.

Czech speakers treasure sincerity. Your heartfelt attempt to express love in their language shows commitment that speaks louder than perfect pronunciation.

articles.title: Hongaars vs. Nederlands: De Belangrijkste Verschillen
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Hongaars en Nederlands zijn HEEL verschillende talen. Hongaars is een Fins-Oegrische taal, terwijl Nederlands Germaans is. Hier zijn de belangrijkste verschillen!

## Taalfamilies

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Fins-Oegrisch vs. Germaans"
  translation="Totaal verschillende taalfamilies"

  context="Hongaars is verwant aan Fins en Estisch - niet aan Europese buren!"
/>

| Kenmerk | Hongaars | Nederlands |
|---------|----------|------------|
| Taalfamilie | Fins-Oegrisch | Germaans |
| Verwante talen | Fins, Estisch | Duits, Engels |
| Type | Agglutinerend | Flexief |
| Geslachten | 0 | 2 (de/het) |

<CultureTip title="Unieke Taal" flag="üá≠üá∫">
Hongaars is een van de weinige niet-Indo-Europese talen in Europa. Dit maakt het uniek √©n uitdagend!
</CultureTip>

## Agglutinatie: Woorden Bouwen

Het GROOTSTE verschil! Hongaars plakt uitgangen aan woorden:

<VocabCard
  word="h√°z ‚Üí h√°zban ‚Üí h√°zaimban"
  translation="huis ‚Üí in het huis ‚Üí in mijn huizen"
  pronunciation="haz ‚Üí HAZ-ban ‚Üí HA-za-eem-ban"
  example="√â√©n woord in het Hongaars = meerdere woorden in het Nederlands!"
/>

| Hongaars | Letterlijk | Nederlands |
|----------|------------|------------|
| h√°z | huis | huis |
| h√°zam | huis-mijn | mijn huis |
| h√°zaim | huis-mijn-meervoud | mijn huizen |
| h√°zaimban | huis-mijn-meervoud-in | in mijn huizen |

## Geen Grammaticaal Geslacht

<VocabCard
  word="≈ë = hij/zij"
  translation="E√©n woord voor beide geslachten!"
  pronunciation="ur"
  example="≈ê sz√©p. (Hij/Zij is mooi.)"
/>

| Hongaars | Nederlands |
|----------|------------|
| ≈ë | hij/zij |
| ≈ëk | zij (meervoud) |
| a bar√°tom | mijn vriend/vriendin |

## Woordvolgorde

### Vrije Woordvolgorde met Nadruk

<VocabCard
  word="Nadruk voor het werkwoord"
  translation="Wat voor het werkwoord staat, krijgt nadruk"

  example="T√©ged szeretlek = JOU heb ik lief"
/>

| Hongaars | Nadruk | Nederlands |
|----------|--------|------------|
| Szeretlek | Neutraal | Ik hou van je |
| T√©ged szeretlek | Op "jou" | JOU heb ik lief |
| √ân szeretlek | Op "ik" | IK hou van je |

## Twee Werkwoordvervoegingen

Hongaars heeft bepaalde EN onbepaalde vervoegingen:

<VocabCard
  word="L√°tok vs. L√°tom"
  translation="Ik zie (iets) vs. Ik zie het"
  pronunciation="LA-tok vs. LA-tom"
  example="Onbepaald vs. bepaald object!"
/>

| Type | Gebruik | Voorbeeld |
|------|---------|-----------|
| Onbepaald | Geen specifiek object | L√°tok egy h√°zat (Ik zie een huis) |
| Bepaald | Specifiek/bekend object | L√°tom a h√°zat (Ik zie het huis) |

<CultureTip title="Speciale -lak/-lek" flag="üíï">
"Szeretlek" (ik hou van JOU) is speciaal - het combineert "ik" als onderwerp en "jou" als object in √©√©n werkwoordvorm!
</CultureTip>

## Naamvallen: 18+ in het Hongaars!

<VocabCard
  word="Hongaarse naamvallen vs. geen in Nederlands"
  translation="Hongaars gebruikt uitgangen waar Nederlands voorzetsels gebruikt"

  example="-ban (in), -ra (op/naar), -val (met)"
/>

| Hongaars | Uitgang | Nederlands |
|----------|---------|------------|
| h√°zban | -ban/-ben | in het huis |
| h√°zra | -ra/-re | op/naar het huis |
| h√°zzal | -val/-vel | met het huis |
| h√°zb√≥l | -b√≥l/-b≈ël | uit het huis |
| h√°znak | -nak/-nek | aan/voor het huis |

## Klinkerharmonie

<VocabCard
  word="h√°zban vs. kertben"
  translation="in het huis vs. in de tuin"
  pronunciation="HAZ-ban vs. KERT-ben"
  example="De uitgang past zich aan de klinkers aan!"
/>

| Klinkertype | Klinkers | Uitgang |
|-------------|----------|---------|
| Laag | a, √°, o, √≥, u, √∫ | -ban, -ra, -val |
| Hoog | e, √©, i, √≠, √∂, ≈ë, √º, ≈± | -ben, -re, -vel |

## Namen: Achternaam Eerst!

<VocabCard
  word="Kov√°cs J√°nos = J√°nos Kov√°cs"
  translation="In Hongarije komt de achternaam eerst!"
  pronunciation="KO-vach YA-nosh"
  example="Dit geldt ook voor datums: jaar-maand-dag!"
/>

| Hongaars | Nederlands |
|----------|------------|
| Kov√°cs J√°nos | Johannes Smid |
| 2026. janu√°r 22. | 22 januari 2026 |

## Vergelijkingstabel

| Kenmerk | Hongaars | Nederlands |
|---------|----------|------------|
| Taalfamilie | Fins-Oegrisch | Germaans |
| Geslachten | 0 | 2 |
| Naamvallen | 18+ | 0 |
| Werkwoordvervoegingen | 2 systemen | 1 systeem |
| Klinkerharmonie | Ja | Nee |
| Woordvolgorde | Vrij (nadruk) | Relatief vast |
| Naam volgorde | Achternaam eerst | Voornaam eerst |

## Uitdagingen voor Nederlanders

### 1. Geen Verwante Woorden

<VocabCard
  word="Hongaars is niet verwant"
  translation="Bijna geen herkenbare woorden"

  example="Behalve leenwoorden: telefon, komputer, szendvics"
/>

### 2. Lange Woorden

<VocabCard
  word="megszents√©gtelen√≠thetetlens√©gesked√©seitek√©rt"
  translation="vanwege jullie voortdurende onontwijdbaarheidspogingen"

  example="Een extreem (maar grammaticaal correct) voorbeeld!"
/>

### 3. Uitspraak

| Letter | Uitspraak | Nederlands vergelijk |
|--------|-----------|---------------------|
| gy | dj | Zoals in "diep" maar zachter |
| sz | s | Altijd als s, nooit z |
| s | sj | Zoals in "sjaal" |
| cs | tsj | Zoals in "chips" |
| zs | zj | Zoals in "garage" |
| ny | nj | Zoals in "oranje" |
| ly | j | Zoals in "ja" |

## Voordelen

1. **Logische grammatica** - Regels zijn consistent
2. **Fonetische spelling** - Je schrijft wat je hoort
3. **Geen geslacht** - Geen de/het verwarring
4. **Expressieve taal** - Veel manieren om nuance uit te drukken

<CultureTip title="Geduld" flag="‚è≥">
Hongaars leren kost tijd, maar elke stap is vooruitgang! Hongaren waarderen enorm als je hun taal probeert te spreken.
</CultureTip>


## Tips voor Succes

1. **Focus op patronen** - Hongaars is logisch als je het patroon ziet
2. **Leer klinkerharmonie** - Dit maakt alles makkelijker
3. **Begin met veelgebruikte uitgangen** - -ban/-ben, -nak/-nek
4. **Oefen uitspraak** - Luister veel naar gesproken Hongaars
5. **Wees geduldig** - Het is een marathon, geen sprint

## Snelle Geheugensteun

| Als je dit in NL zegt | Let op in het Hongaars |
|----------------------|------------------------|
| In het huis | H√°zban (√©√©n woord!) |
| Mijn huizen | H√°zaim (uitgang = bezit + meervoud) |
| Hij/zij | ≈ê (geen onderscheid!) |
| Ik zie het | L√°tom (bepaalde vervoeging) |

<CTA
  text="Klaar om de uitdaging aan te gaan?"
  buttonText="Start met Hongaars Leren"
/>

articles.title: Frases en Griego para Pedir y Ofrecer Perd√≥n a tu Pareja
articles.content:
Los griegos expresan el perd√≥n con pasi√≥n. Estas frases te ayudar√°n con tu pareja griega.

## Frases para Pedir Perd√≥n

### "ŒõœÖœÄŒ¨ŒºŒ±Œπ œÄœÅŒ±Œ≥ŒºŒ±œÑŒπŒ∫Œ¨" (Lipame pragmatika)
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** li-PA-me prag-ma-ti-KA

**Significado:** Lo siento de verdad

### "Œ£Œµ œÄŒ±œÅŒ±Œ∫Œ±Œªœé, œÉœÖŒ≥œáœéœÅŒµœÉŒ≠ ŒºŒµ" (Se parakalo, sinchorese me)
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** Se pa-ra-ka-LO sin-JO-re-se me

**Significado:** Por favor, perd√≥name

### "ŒûŒ≠œÅœâ œåœÑŒπ œÉŒµ œÄŒªŒÆŒ≥œâœÉŒ± Œ∫Œ±Œπ œÑŒø ŒºŒµœÑŒ±ŒΩŒπœéŒΩœâ Œ≤Œ±Œ∏ŒπŒ¨" (Xero oti se pligosa ke to metaniono vathia)
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** KSE-ro O-ti se PLI-go-sa ke to me-ta-nio-NO va-THI-a

**Significado:** S√© que te her√≠ y lo lamento profundamente
